## Upcoming Events {#upcoming-events}


-   **November 19, 2025** - GIS Day\
    IKB Library, University of British Columbia, BC, CA  

    ![](images/clipboard-1628135356.png)

    GIS Day is an annual worldwide celebration of Geographic Information Systems (GIS) technology and community, dedicated to promoting geospatial literacy, education, and awareness. This event brings together **students, educators, researchers, and industry professionals** who share an interest in geography, cartography, remote sensing, spatial data science, and related fields.\
    <https://gis.ubc.ca/event/gis-day-2025/>
    
-   **December 2, 2025** - Free SCGIS Webinar:\
    Advancing Conservation and Community Resilience with Thermal and Hyperspectral Remote Sensing:     Applications from NASA’s ECOSTRESS and EMIT Missions\
    This upcoming webinar will first highlight the use of ECOSTRESS data for urban heat analysis and   mitigation. It will then introduce conservation-related applications of EMIT data, including habitat as well as plant trait and diversity mapping. Finally, the last presentation will explore a combined use of both EMIT and ECOSTRESS data for assessing pre-wildfire risk in Los Angeles, California.
    <https://us06web.zoom.us/webinar/register/WN_P-WgfwuYQButrB-Cdjgm0Q#/registration>
